page.title: 08A Village Hall in Cumbria
page.content: The new Village Hall at Sebergham was built in 1983. It was financed by a large donation from Laings (the national building contractors) who built their first house in the village. There were grants from the local and county councils, and parishoners raised Â£3000. The interior is wood panelled, the hall seats about 80. Being bright and new it is much in demand for functions. It is also used for local community events, clubs and classes. Charges range from Â£3 per hour for meetings to Â£25 for dances. There is a twice weekly Playgroup which is well supported. The Sebergham Women's Institute meets at the Hall, there are about 20 members. The Hall is administered by a Committee of 30, representing 24 local families.
